card.name: Abu Ja'far
card.property: When Abu Ja'far dies, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by it. They can't be regenerated.

card.name: Army of Allah
card.property: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: On the day of victory no one is tired. —Arab proverb

card.name: Camel
card.property: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.) As long as Camel is attacking, prevent all damage Deserts would deal to Camel and to creatures banded with Camel.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Everyone knew Walid was a pious man, for he had been blessed with many sons, many jewels, and a great many Camels.

card.name: Eye for an Eye
card.property: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

card.name: Jihad
card.property: As Jihad enters the battlefield, choose a color and an opponent. White creatures get +2/+1 as long as the chosen player controls a nontoken permanent of the chosen color. When the chosen player controls no nontoken permanents of the chosen color, sacrifice Jihad.

card.name: King Suleiman
card.property: {T}: Destroy target Djinn or Efreet.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "We made tempestuous winds obedient to Solomon . . . And many of the devils We also made obedient to him."—The Qur'an, 21:81

card.name: Moorish Cavalry
card.property: Trample

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Members of the elite Moorish Cavalry are very particular about their mounts, choosing only those whose bloodlines have been pure for generations.

card.name: Piety
card.property: Blocking creatures get +0/+3 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success." —The Qur'an, 24:52

card.name: Repentant Blacksmith
card.property: Protection from red

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "For my confession they burned me with fire And found that I was for endurance made." —The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

card.name: Shahrazad
card.property: Players play a Magic subgame, using their libraries as their decks. Each player who doesn't win the subgame loses half their life, rounded up.

card.name: War Elephant
card.property: Trample; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "When elephants fight it is the grass that suffers." —Kikuyu Proverb

card.name: Dandân
card.property: Dandân can't attack unless defending player controls an Island. When you control no Islands, sacrifice Dandân.

card.name: Fishliver Oil
card.property: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Then the maiden bade him cast off his robes and cover his body with fishliver oil, that he might safely follow her into the sea.

card.name: Flying Men
card.property: Flying

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Saffiyah clapped her hands and twenty flying men appeared at her side, each well trained in the art of combat.

card.name: Giant Tortoise
card.property: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

card.name: Island Fish Jasconius
card.property: Island Fish Jasconius doesn't untap during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {U}{U}{U}. If you do, untap Island Fish Jasconius. Island Fish Jasconius can't attack unless defending player controls an Island. When you control no Islands, sacrifice Island Fish Jasconius.

card.name: Merchant Ship
card.property: Merchant Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island. Whenever Merchant Ship attacks and isn't blocked, you gain 2 life. When you control no Islands, sacrifice Merchant Ship.

card.name: Old Man of the Sea
card.property: You may choose not to untap Old Man of the Sea during your untap step. {T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to Old Man of the Sea's power for as long as Old Man of the Sea remains tapped and that creature's power remains less than or equal to Old Man of the Sea's power.

card.name: Serendib Djinn
card.property: Flying At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a land. If you sacrifice an Island this way, Serendib Djinn deals 3 damage to you. When you control no lands, sacrifice Serendib Djinn.

card.name: Serendib Efreet
card.property: Flying At the beginning of your upkeep, Serendib Efreet deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Sindbad
card.property: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.

card.name: Unstable Mutation
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +3/+3. At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

card.name: Cuombajj Witches
card.property: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to any target of an opponent's choice.

card.name: El-Hajjâj
card.property: Whenever El-Hajjâj deals damage, you gain that much life.

card.name: Erg Raiders
card.property: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

card.name: Guardian Beast
card.property: As long as Guardian Beast is untapped, noncreature artifacts you control can't be enchanted, they have indestructible, and other players can't gain control of them. This effect doesn't remove Auras already attached to those artifacts.

card.name: Hasran Ogress
card.property: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.

card.name: Junún Efreet
card.property: Flying At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junún Efreet unless you pay {B}{B}.

card.name: Juzám Djinn
card.property: At the beginning of your upkeep, Juzám Djinn deals 1 damage to you.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Expect my visit when the darkness comes. The night I think is best for hiding all." —Ouallada

card.name: Khabál Ghoul
card.property: At the beginning of each end step, put a +1/+1 counter on Khabál Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.

card.name: Oubliette
card.property: When Oubliette enters the battlefield, exile target creature and all Auras attached to it. Note the number and kind of counters that were on that creature. When Oubliette leaves the battlefield, return that exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control tapped with the noted number and kind of counters on it. If you do, return the other exiled cards to the battlefield under their owner's control attached to that permanent.

card.name: Sorceress Queen
card.property: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.

card.name: Stone-Throwing Devils
card.property: First strike

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Sometimes those with the most sin cast the first stones.

card.name: Aladdin
Ali Baba
card.property: {R}: Tap target Wall.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "When he reached the entrance of the cavern, he pronounced the words, 'Open, Sesame!'" —The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.

card.name: Ali from Cairo
card.property: Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

card.name: Bird Maiden
card.property: Flying

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Four things that never meet do here unite To shed my blood and to ravage my heart, A radiant brow and tresses that beguile And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile." —The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

card.name: Desert Nomads
card.property: Desertwalk Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Desert Nomads by Deserts.

card.name: Hurr Jackal
card.property: {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.

card.name: Kird Ape
card.property: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.

card.name: Magnetic Mountain
card.property: Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped blue creatures they control and pay {4} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

card.name: Mijae Djinn
card.property: Whenever Mijae Djinn attacks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Mijae Djinn from combat and tap it.

card.name: Rukh Egg
card.property: When Rukh Egg dies, create a 4/4 red Bird creature token with flying at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Ydwen Efreet
card.property: Whenever Ydwen Efreet blocks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Ydwen Efreet from combat and it can't block this turn. Creatures it was blocking that had become blocked by only Ydwen Efreet this combat become unblocked.

card.name: Cyclone
card.property: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wind counter on Cyclone, then sacrifice Cyclone unless you pay {G} for each wind counter on it. If you pay, Cyclone deals damage equal to the number of wind counters on it to each creature and each player.

card.name: Desert Twister
card.property: Destroy target permanent.

card.name: Drop of Honey
card.property: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy the creature with the least power. It can't be regenerated. If two or more creatures are tied for least power, you choose one of them. When there are no creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Drop of Honey.

card.name: Erhnam Djinn
card.property: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

card.name: Ghazbán Ogre
card.property: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.

card.name: Ifh-Bíff Efreet
card.property: Flying {G}: Ifh-Bíff Efreet deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.

card.name: Metamorphosis
card.property: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature. Add X mana of any one color, where X is 1 plus the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.

card.name: Nafs Asp
card.property: Whenever Nafs Asp deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of their next draw step unless they pay {1} before that draw step.

card.name: Sandstorm
card.property: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

card.name: Singing Tree
card.property: {T}: Target attacking creature has base power 0 until end of turn.

card.name: Wyluli Wolf
card.property: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?" —Maimun al-Wyluli, Diary

card.name: Aladdin's Lamp
card.property: {X}, {T}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead look at the top X cards of your library, put all but one of them on the bottom of your library in a random order, then draw a card. X can't be 0.

card.name: Aladdin's Ring
card.property: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to any target.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "After these words the magician drew a ring off his finger, and put it on one of Aladdin's, saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'" —The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.

card.name: Bottle of Suleiman
card.property: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, create a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

card.name: Brass Man
card.property: Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.

card.name: City in a Bottle
card.property: Whenever one or more other nontoken permanents with a name originally printed in the Arabian Nights expansion are on the battlefield, their controllers sacrifice them. Players can't cast spells or play lands with a name originally printed in the Arabian Nights expansion.

card.name: Dancing Scimitar
card.property: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.

card.name: Ebony Horse
card.property: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

card.name: Flying Carpet
card.property: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Jandor's Ring
card.property: {2}, {T}, Discard the last card you drew this turn: Draw a card.

card.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
card.property: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Each day of their journey, Jandor opened the saddlebags and found them full of mutton, quinces, cheese, date rolls, wine, and all manner of delicious and satisfying foods.

card.name: Jeweled Bird
card.property: Remove Jeweled Bird from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante. {T}: Ante Jeweled Bird. If you do, put all other cards you own from the ante into your graveyard, then draw a card.

card.name: Pyramids
card.property: {2}: Choose one — • Destroy target Aura attached to a land. • The next time target land would be destroyed this turn, remove all damage marked on it instead.

card.name: Ring of Ma'rûf
card.property: {5}, {T}, Exile Ring of Ma'rûf: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead choose a card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand.

card.name: Sandals of Abdallah
card.property: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains islandwalk until end of turn. When that creature dies this turn, destroy Sandals of Abdallah. (A creature with islandwalk can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

card.name: Bazaar of Baghdad
card.property: {T}: Draw two cards, then discard three cards.

card.name: City of Brass
card.property: Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you. {T}: Add one mana of any color.

card.name: Desert
card.property: {T}: Add {C}. {T}: Desert deals 1 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the end of combat step.

card.name: Diamond Valley
card.property: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

card.name: Elephant Graveyard
card.property: {T}: Add {C}. {T}: Regenerate target Elephant.

card.name: Island of Wak-Wak
card.property: {T}: Target creature with flying has base power 0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Isle of Wak-Wak, home to a tribe of winged folk, is named for a peculiar fruit that grows there. The fruit looks like a woman's head, and when ripe speaks the word "Wak."

card.name: Library of Alexandria
card.property: {T}: Add {C}. {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have exactly seven cards in hand.

card.name: Oasis
card.property: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
